Definition: Name of the scenario assessed
Scientific name of the species
Common name of the species
Geographic area assessed
Name of the assessor
Taxonomic group of the species
Whether the species is migratory and exposure data for the migratory range that lies outside of the assessment area was provided
Whether the species is an obligate of caves or groundwater systems
Calculated CCVI index
Level of confidence in the CCVI index result. This is based on the proportion of Monte Carlo results that had different index values
Index of migratory exposure
Total score from sections B and C the indirect exposure, sensitivity and adaptive capacity questions
Total score from section D the modelled response to climate change section
The proportion of Monte Carlo runs with each CCVI index result

The percentage of the species' range that is exposed to each class of change in mean annual temperature between the historical normal and predicted climate. Class 1 has the highest exposure and Class 6 the lowest

The percentage of the species' range that is exposed to each class of change in climate moisture deficit between the historical normal and predicted climate. Class 1 has the highest exposure and Class 6 the lowest
The percentage of the species' non-breeding range that falls into each climate change exposure index class. Class 1 indicates high exposure while Class 4 indicates low exposure
The precentage of the non-breeding range that overlaps the CCEI raster data
The percentage of the species' range that is exposed to each class of variation between the historical coldest and warmest months. Class 1 has the smallest variation and Class 4 is the largest
The percentage of the species' range that falls into cool or cold environments that may be lost or reduced in the assessment area as a result of climate change
The maximum and minimum historical mean annual precipitation in the species' range
The projected decrease in range size as a percentage of current range size. Negative numbers indicate an increase in range size
The percentage of the current range that is projected to remain in the future range.
The area of the species' range in m2
The percentage of the future range that overlaps protected areas.
Gain modifier. Used to down-weight modelled range gains
Explaination for gain modifier choice
lower, upper bounds for raster values interpreted as range lost under climate change
lower, upper bounds for raster values interpreted as range maintained under climate change
lower, upper bounds for raster values interpreted as range gained under climate change
lower, upper bounds for raster values interpreted as not suitable habitat at any point
Whether range change rasters showing projected future change in species range were used. Options are no, one, or multiple

Answers to each question plus any comments. -1) No selection, 0) Neutral, 1) Somewhat increase, 2) Increase, 3) Greatly increase. If there are 2 numbers then two boxes were checked and the average of the scores was used in the total score
1) Exposure to sea level rise
a) Natural barriers
b) Anthropogenic barriers
3) Predicted impact of land use changes resulting from human responses to climate change
1) Dispersal and movements
i) historical thermal niche
ii) physiological thermal niche
i) historical hydrological niche
ii) physiological hydrological niche
c) Dependence on a specific disturbance regime likely to be impacted by climate change
d) Dependence on ice, ice-edge, or snow-cover habitats
3) Restriction to uncommon landscape/geological features or derivatives
a) Dependence on other species to generate required habitat
b) Dietary versatility (animals only)
c) Pollinator versatility (plants only)
d) Dependence on other species for propagule dispersal
e) Sensitivity to pathogens or natural enemies
f) Sensitivity to competition from native or non-native species
g) Forms part of an interspecific interaction not covered by 5a-f
a) Measured genetic variation
b) Occurrence of bottlenecks in recent evolutionary history (use only if 5a is "unknown")
c) Reproductive system (plants only; use only if C5a and C5b are ?unknown?)
6) Phenological response to changing seasonal temperature and precipitation dynamics
1) Documented response to recent climate change
2) Modeled future (2050) change in population or range size
3) Overlap of modeled future (2050) range with current range
4) Occurrence of protected areas in modeled future (2050) distribution
Name of the climate model
Time period for the historical data
Time period for the future climate projections
Emissions scenario used for climate projections
Url for where the climate data was downloaded from
Path to range polygon shapefile
Path to assessment area polygon shapefile
Path to nonbreeding range polygon shapefile
Path to physiological thermal niche polygon shapefile
Path to folder of climate data
Path to range change raster (for each scenario if multiple provided)
The version number of the ccviR package used to complete the assessment
